text: using a db would work, but remember that the minting and transfer of nfts should be really secure and we shouldn't add a point of failure in our system since we are talking about distributed system when working with web 3. if we can use smart contracts to mint the nft we won't even need to to share the asset-id, the trainee can directly read that from the smart-contract.

text: to add to what <@u03u1fnpeux> said you can also use the dev net by running the `./sandbox up dev -v`  command or you can use the test net by running the `./sandbox up test -v`  command. and also remember to use the `-v`  argument in order to get a more descriptive log output to your terminal.

elements.text: to add to what
said you can also use the dev net by running the
./sandbox up dev -v

./sandbox up test -v
command. and also remember to use the
-v
argument in order to get a more descriptive log output to your terminal.

text: no it is not required to use smart contracts but it would be great if you could have smart contract implementation. try to use a distributed system if you want to go for db instead of using a non-distributed system which could be a single-point of failure and you should be able to show how secure it is because nft management needs to be very secure. think of other ways that you can share the asset-id to the respective trainee that can be secure and wouldn't use much of web2 tech.
